# News comment title:
Ann Coulter: How to Provide Universal Health Care Using This One Easy Trick

# Oldest comment (from the thread):
Absolutely correct. The floater in the punch bowl, as she said, is fraud. Absolute accountability, and no exemptions for politicians, would be a start.

# Most liked comment (from the thread):
Free Market Capitalism...what a concept!

>>> COMMENT UNDER ANALYSIS<<<


No, but I am a student of economics, including the economics of health care. 
The cost of auto insurance is driven by the  cost of automobiles, with a premium for liability. If the cost of auto insurance is sky high, it's probably not the fault of the insurance company.
The United States suffers from an artificial shortage of health-care providers, which forces us to import doctors and nurses from Timbuktu every year. It's an outrage! We need a supply-side solution!

>>> END COMMENT <<<

# News comment title:
Ann Coulter: How to Provide Universal Health Care Using This One Easy Trick

# Oldest comment (from the thread):
Absolutely correct. The floater in the punch bowl, as she said, is fraud. Absolute accountability, and no exemptions for politicians, would be a start.

# Most liked comment (from the thread):
Free Market Capitalism...what a concept!

>>> COMMENT UNDER ANALYSIS<<<


I asked for evidence, and you gave me theory! Regarding Western Europe: There are reasons that health care costs less in Western Europe. I would rather not go down this rat hole. Let me  say this: Western Europe does not suffer  the artificial  shortage  of health-care providers that the American public has endured for generations; pharmacists and nurses play a greater role  in the health  care systems of Western Europe (or, so I've read). And doctors tend to make less money.
The VA has rationed  health care for decades. It's not the worst system  in  the world, but this doesn't square with your theory.
In the US, putting Medicare in a strong bargaining position means that the medical lobby controls both parties. I don't think we should lose sight of  this. Political power is in the hands of wealthy interest groups, who buy influence (from willing sellers).

>>> END COMMENT <<<
